patchlogs.name: Update 21: Chains of Harrow
patchlogs.changes: A “Cannot Use in Archwing” HUD message will now appear under the ability bar when attempting to use Liset Air Support Charges and Kinetic Syphon Traps while in Archwing missions.

patchlogs.name: Update: Specters of the Rail
patchlogs.fixes:
Fixed Client Xiphos’ Sentry Guns Air Support Charges remaining in mission even if the Client has aborted. Sentry Guns will now be removed if the Client has left the mission.
Fixed an issue with Sentry Gun Air Support Charges disappearing after Host migration.

patchlogs.name: Update 17.5: The Jordas Precept. + Hotfix 17.5.1
patchlogs.additions:
Players can now call in support from their Landing Craft mid-Mission via Air Support Charges.Air Support Charges effects are unique to each Landing Craft.
Air Support Charges can be constructed in the Foundry and equipped in the Arsenal under Gear.
Air Support Charges have a 10 minute cooldown between each use.
Players will first need to construct the Landing Craft Segment in their Foundry, enabling them to construct Landing Craft and Air Support Charges.
Landing Craft Segment: Allows construction of Landing Craft and Air Support Charges in the Foundry.

patchlogs.name: Echoes of Veilbreaker: Update 32.1
patchlogs.fixes: Hotdropped fix from last week: Fixed a case where purchasing both the Riven Cipher from Teshin and the Archon Shard from Chipper in the same week caused them to be unable to be purchased again on the reset. As reported here: https://forums.warframe.com/topic/1328361-weekly-veiled-riven-cipherweekly-archon-shard-not-available-fixed/

patchlogs.name: Nidus Prime & Plague Star: Hotfix 30.7.4
patchlogs.fixes: Fixed Defection Hack panel remaining lit and objective marker persisting after Client player uses a Cipher.

patchlogs.name: Update 30.7: Nidus Prime & Plague Star
patchlogs.changes: Added Orokin Ciphers and Omega Isotopes as a feeding option to the Helminth, which will grant Bile.
patchlogs.fixes: Fixed inability to use a Cipher while riding Merulina.

patchlogs.name: Update 30.5: Sisters of Parvos
patchlogs.changes: Veiled Riven Cipher (one a week)

patchlogs.name: Warframe Revised: Hotfix 27.2.1
patchlogs.fixes: Fixed the Cipher x100 Research not granting 3000 Clan Affinity.

patchlogs.name: Empyrean: Ivara Prime 27.0.9
patchlogs.fixes: Fixed an issue with Ciphers that was causing fails not to count properly in fails stat.

patchlogs.name: Fortuna: Hotfix 24.0.9
patchlogs.changes: You can no longer do a Cipher hack if a MOA Companion is already working on it.

patchlogs.name: The Sacrifice: Hotfix 23.0.4
patchlogs.changes: Fixed floating symbols in Orokin Cipher puzzle being invisible if your Warframe is cloaked.

patchlogs.name: The Sacrifice: Hotfix 23.0.3 - Limbo Prime
patchlogs.changes: Tweaked positioning of Orokin Symbols and area markers to help players find the markings closest to the Orokin Cipher first.

patchlogs.name: Hydroid Prime: Update 21.6.0
patchlogs.changes: Reduced the Razorback Cipher cost from 3500 Polymer Bundle to 1500 Polymer Bundle. Back in May of this year we made numerous fixes towards the Razorback Armada, and with another Armada to appear soon we took a second look at the Polymer friction involved with this non-useable Blueprint. See here for past fixes you can expect: https://forums.warframe.com/topic/797284-sharpening-our-razorbacks-a-pc-weekend-post-mortem/

patchlogs.name: Update 18.8.0
patchlogs.fixes: •    Fixed players not receiving Orokin Ciphers or Corrupted Mods after completing the Derelict Survival Vault and surviving 10+ minutes.

patchlogs.name: Update 17.11.0 + 17.11.0.1
patchlogs.fixes: Fixed an issue preventing the Steam Controller to interact with the Cipher button for hacking puzzles or the Battle/Extract menu on Defense Missions.

patchlogs.name: Update 17.5: The Jordas Precept. + Hotfix 17.5.1
patchlogs.additions: Landing Craft Liset: Features the Air Support: Cipher.

patchlogs.name: Mesa Update

Survival start mission console Ciphers will now be easy, regardless of enemy levels.
Fixed Ciphers not solving Corpus minigames.

patchlogs.name: Hotfix 15.0.9
patchlogs.fixes: Fixed Ciphers not being usable for Grineer hack panels.

patchlogs.name: Hotfix 15.0.6
patchlogs.fixes: Optimized both Grineer and Corpus Cipher minigames.

patchlogs.name: Hotfix 15.0.1
patchlogs.fixes: Fixed Cipher minigames not working with a controller.

patchlogs.name: Warframe: Archwing
patchlogs.changes: Ciphers now scale in difficulty with enemy level.

Fixed an issue with Cipher voice overs not playing correctly.
Adjusted Cipher spawn timing.
Added additional weapon switch hints near the Cipher.
Changed the context action text to properly show "Cipher".
Added in additional visual cues near the Cipher pickup area.

patchlogs.name: Update 13: Dark Sectors
patchlogs.changes: Changed 'Grineer Cipher' to 'Cipher' as they appear across different tilesets.

patchlogs.name: Hotfix 11.0.1

patchlogs.name: Heart of Deimos: Update 29
patchlogs.additions: Oxylus Sentinel will scan plants within 20m over 5s. This consumes Codex Scanner charges.

patchlogs.name: Update 26: The Old Blood
patchlogs.changes: Another common issue in user feedback was the unequipping of Gear Items (like the Codex Scanner), or dropping the ‘football’ (usually a pickup for Mobile Defense or Sabotage Missions) when equipping melee or using a melee attack. This has now been changed so that you will no longer drop items or unequip Gear Items when either equipping melee or using a Melee Attack!

patchlogs.name: Warframe: Archwing
patchlogs.fixes: Fixed a number of problems with the Codex Scanner (including Helios’s user of the Scanner):Fixed handling of certain compound objects like Death Orbs (you could not scan them and neither could Helios).

patchlogs.name: Hotfix 14.10.3

patchlogs.name: 13.4.0: Serro + Psa!

patchlogs.name: Nightwave: Intermission III: Update 29.7.0
patchlogs.fixes: Intermission rewards are sometimes a repeat of the previous Nightwave series, and while newer players might delight in getting some of these new items, we wanted to add a way for it to still be rewarding for returning Dreamers! We accomplish this by giving a 50 Nightwave Intermission Credit reward instead of a previously owned item. This does not apply to items such as Warframe Slots, or consumable items (such as Forma), but rather for owned, unique items such as previous Nightwave Cosmetics.

patchlogs.name: Plains of Eidolon Remaster: Update 24.6.0
patchlogs.changes: You can now track and tranq animals in the Plains! Master Teasonai will be your source for Echo-Lures and Rarity Boosters as you track down, capture and get these animals to safety. Echo-Lures are not required as these animals continually roam the Plains, but calling them will bring them running (or flying!). A new Conservation Badge and Floofs from Master Teasonai await your efforts.

patchlogs.name: Buried Debts: Update 24.4.0
patchlogs.changes: Re-enabled ability to equip multiple Echo-Lures to the Gear Wheel. This allows for quicker access to desired Echo-Lure when in that heated Conservation moment!

patchlogs.name: Fortuna: Mesa Prime - Hotfix 24.2.2
patchlogs.changes: When completing a successful animal Conservation using a Warframe ability, it will yield a ‘Good Capture’, as opposed to sometimes yielding a ‘Perfect Capture’. A successful animal Conservation using the tried-and-true Tranq/Echo-Lure technique was always intended to yield a higher gratitude.

patchlogs.name: Fortuna: The Profit-Taker - Update 24.2
patchlogs.changes:
Animal Pheromone Synthesizer items have been added to The Business’ Offerings! When deployed before using an Echo-Lure, these increase the chance of attracting a Rare variant of the respective animal. 
Fixed the UI breaking and Echo-Lure/Tranq/Mining Lasers not functioning after dismounting a K-Drive.
Fixed having no weapon when getting downed while the Echo-Lure or Tranq is equipped.
Fixed Echo-Lure’s not changing pitch for Clients.
Fixed a case of the Echo-Lure UI indicator not matching true pitch of the animal call.

patchlogs.name: Fortuna: Hotfix 24.1.2 + 24.1.2.1
patchlogs.changes: Echo-Lures no longer need to be equipped in your Gear Spiral, they are auto-equipped in the Conservation gear when a Tranq is equipped.

patchlogs.name: Fortuna: Hotfix 24.1.1 + 24.1.1.1

name: Fomorian Disruptor

patchlogs.name: Beasts of the Sanctuary: Hotfix 22.20.1
patchlogs.fixes: Fixed crashing when attempting to play the Fomorian mission and a squad member is missing the required Fomorian Disruptor in their Gear.

patchlogs.name: Update 15.8.0
patchlogs.fixes:
Intelligence reports state that the Balor Fomorian’s power core emits a thick energy field composed of deadly omega radiation. In order to break through the field you will need to craft this Fomorian Disruptor. It will allow you to safely approach the core and when activated it will temporarily disrupt the core allowing you to inflict damage.
Fomorian Vessels will intermittently appear in the Solar System as event nodes. These event nodes will be locked until you have the Fomorian Disruptor in your Consumable Inventory.
You will receive a Blueprint from the Lotus for the Fomorian Disruptor. It will require Nano Spores, Cryotic, and Omega Isotopes to craft.
The Fomorian’s internal Shield Generators are protected by a magnetic field. Use your Fomorian Disruptor from the Gear menu to disrupt the magnetic field, and temporarily expose the Shield Generators, allowing you to destroy them.
Your Fomorian Disruptor will be consumed after completing the Fomorian Sabotage mission.
Leaderboards are available for players that want to compete for the best score during Fomorian Sabotage Missions. Your individual score is determined by the amount of damage dealt to the Fomorian Power Core during a single run. The highest scores can only be achieved by squads with coordinated deployment of Fomorian Disruptors, and efficient attacks on the Power Cores.

*In order for Luminous Dye and Pharoma to work within this system, they are now thrown like bait. They float in the water and affect all fish in the same body of water within a certain radius. patchlogs.fixes: This also fixes spot-loading with Sentinel weapons if you had no Sentinel equipped and Necramech equipment if you didn't have the Necramech Summon equipped.

patchlogs.name: Corpus Proxima & The New Railjack: Hotfix 29.10.7
patchlogs.fixes: Fixed Necramech Summon not refreshing it’s cooldown after summoning a Necramech that has died as a Client.

patchlogs.name: Heart of Deimos: Update 29.1.0
patchlogs.changes:
Currently there is a 3 minute cooldown on every use of the Necramech Summon Gear item. We’ve changed the cooldown behavior of the Necramech Summon to reflect the following:
If the player's Necramech is still active, then the Necramech Summon only has a 10 second cooldown. Summoning it this way will move the Necramech to the player's desired position but NOT restore its Health/Shields/Energy.
If the player's Necramech has been destroyed, then the Necramech Summon has a 3 minute cooldown, and will have its Health/Shields/Energy refilled on summon.

patchlogs.name: Heart of Deimos: Update 29
patchlogs.fixes: In HEART OF DEIMOS, we are launching 1 NECRAMECH, found in the NECRALOID Syndicate! It is fully colour customizable, has 4 Unique Abilities (like a Warframe) and can be summoned for Transference via the NECRAMECH SUMMON Gear Item for use in ANY Open World! The Necramech Summon Gear Item is awarded upon crafting your first Necramech!

With ‘Auto Omni’ and ‘Cordon’ as default Precepts, this Sentinel is the ideal companion for long voyages aboard a Railjack.

patchlogs.name: Heart of Deimos: Hotfix 29.0.2
patchlogs.fixes: Fixed a Heart of Deimos Quest progression stop due to an inability to swap back to the Omni repair tool when it’s required.

patchlogs.name: The Steel Path: Hotfix 28.1.1
patchlogs.fixes:
Fixed right-D-pad equipping Omni-tool (or doing nothing in regular Archwing missions) instead of cycling to the next Warframe/Archwing ability. This is actually still fixed!
Fixes towards Omni-tool binding sometimes not working correctly when using a controller.
Fixed an issue reported here where the binding for equipping the Omni-tool was missing when playing with a controller if you had customized your bindings prior to the release of Railjack. Players on PC may have to manually restore the bindings.

patchlogs.name: The Steel Path: Update 28.1.0
patchlogs.fixes: Fixed right-D-pad equipping Omni-tool (or doing nothing in regular Archwing missions) instead of cycling to the next Warframe/Archwing ability.

patchlogs.name: Nightwave Series 3: Glassmaker: Hotfix 27.5.3
patchlogs.fixes: Fixed a few cases where bindings under the General tab would sometimes override a binding in a more specific tab. For example, on a controller, if you bound Right-D-Pad to Tactical Menu under General and bound it to Omni-Tool under Power Menu, it would open the Tactical Menu even when you were using the Power Menu.

patchlogs.name: Warframe Revised: Railjack Revisited (Part 1): Hotfix 27.4.3
patchlogs.changes: Your Pet Companions will now teleport alongside you when transitioning between different regions in a Railjack mission (ie Omni Recall, Archwing Slingshot, boarding a Crewship via Archwing, etc).

patchlogs.name: Warframe Revised: Railjack Revisited (Part 1): Update 27.4
patchlogs.changes:
Added an Omni Tool binding when using a controller! The default binding is RB + Right Directional-Pad button, to customize go into your Options > Controls > Customize Controller > Ability Menu > Bind ‘Equip Omni’. 
The Omni Tool will only be equipped using this shortcut option if it is in the Gear Wheel!
The Omni tool will now slot into the first available slot in the Gear Wheel when given to players instead of being appended to the end.
Removed unnecessary ability to use the Omni tool outside of Railjack missions.
Increased the amount of Omni Revolite required to remove hazard events, but increased the XP gained.
patchlogs.fixes: Fixed seeing a [PH] Equip Omni Tool under the Customize Controller > Ability Menu.

patchlogs.name: Warframe Revised: Update 27.2.0
patchlogs.changes:
2 seconds of invulnerability will be given when using context actions and the Omni Recall.
Quick Meleeing with the Omni tool in hand will no longer unequip the Omni. This is now consistent with other Gear items, like Fishing/Mining. 
Fixed an edge case where using a Turret or doing a finisher in a Crewship when the Omni tool's countdown expired could leave you in a broken state and not recalling you.
Fixed being equipped with your Parazon or completely unarmed if you use the Crafting Forge in your Railjack while your Omni Tool or Scanner is equipped.

patchlogs.name: Empyrean: Kuva Lich Changes 27.1.0 + 27.1.0.1
patchlogs.changes:
Omni tool is now available as a Gear item in your Inventory (Archwing Quest completion required)! This allows you to place the Omni tool in your preferred Gear spot for quick access!
If you forget to equip the Omni tool in your Gear upon entering a Railjack mission it will still be given to you for the mission.
Optimized the Omni tool to fix a hitch when equipping it.

patchlogs.name: Empyrean: Ivara Prime 27.0.11 - 27.0.11.3
patchlogs.changes:
Affinity gained from all Omni tool Repairs and Forge actions aboard the Railjack is now shared with the squad!
Previously, only the player who performed the Repair with the Omni tool/Forge action gained Affinity. Now, when any individual completes tasks with the Omni tool or Forge, the Affinity will be shared across all members. This is not restricted to those onboard the Railjack

patchlogs.name: Empyrean: Ivara Prime 27.0.9
patchlogs.changes:
These Icons show what your squadmates are doing, including: pilot, gunner, cannon, Omni Tool, Archwing, at a point of interest, engineering, fighting a boarding team, in slingshot, in Crewship, or just messing around on the Railjack doing nothing specific. 
Fixed Omni tool equip animation causing loss of functionality when mounting emplacements/piloting.
Fixed Omni Tool having an ammo type (which didn’t actually interact with anything).
Fixed Omni Tool showing level ‘0’.

patchlogs.name: Empyrean: Ivara Prime 27.0.7
patchlogs.changes: Fixed activating the Omni gear recall twice in succession resulting in breaking the UI timer, not teleporting you, and inability to use it again.

patchlogs.name: Empyrean: Ivara Prime 27.0.4

description: A device used to manage coordination and resources during Operation Link missions.

patchlogs.name: Scarlet Spear: TennoGen 27.3.10
patchlogs.changes:
The Murex Raid Satellite now must be towed to its correct location before you can deploy the Oplink. 
Fixed a script error when deploying your Oplink in the Ground Assault mission.

patchlogs.name: Operation: Scarlet Spear: TennoGen 27.3.8 + 27.3.8.1 + 27.3.8.2
patchlogs.fixes: We made a hasty change in Hotfix 27.3.6 that removed Venari’s Heal aura from affecting Oplinks AND Defense Targets. Firstly, the terminology of calling Venari’s Defense Target healing a ‘fix’ was incorrect, so apologies there on my behalf. It’s correct to say it was a feature for Venari, considering it had its own Tip for it! The change stemmed from our desire to resolve Operation exploits as quickly as possible, and we didn't communicate this properly.

patchlogs.name: Operation: Scarlet Spear: Titania Prime 27.3.6
patchlogs.changes:
Added a ‘Waiting for Satellite’ UI line when players are in the Murex Raid with their Oplinks down but have neglected to place the Satellite first. A few cases of ‘not receiving codes’ were a result of user error that this should fix. 
Increased the Sentient AI count per player when Defending Oplinks in the Murex Raid mission.
Fixed the UI incorrectly stating that you were ‘Sending Kill Codes’ when an Oplink is deployed in a Murex Raid. It will now properly state that you’re ‘Awaiting Kill Codes’.
Fixed Oplinks placed by a squadmate who has disconnected lingering perpetually.
Fixed Venari’s Healing aura affecting the Oplink.
The Oplink is intended to not be affected by Abilities.
Fixed a script error when placing your Oplink in the Ground Assault mission.

patchlogs.name: Operation: Scarlet Spear: Hotfix 27.3.5
patchlogs.changes: Potential fix towards Clients having no Oplink UI in Murex Raids. This issue also resulted in having no ‘Kill Code Receiver' score upon returning to the Flotilla.

patchlogs.name: Operation: Scarlet Spear: Hotfix 27.3.4
patchlogs.changes:
We’ve also relaxed conditions for players joining the squad at Ground Assault mission start. Now joining is available either before the 'Deploy an Oplink' stage or until 5 minutes expires, whichever is first.
Scarlet Spear Tutorial and Tips have been added to Little Duck’s screen in the Flotilla to give players more robust information within the game on how to approach the Operation and to answer common questions players might have! In addition, you can find Tutorial prompts at the stations surrounding the Oplink Deployments.
Fixed names of Murex Raid Host players that have migrated (no longer in the mission) appearing in the Oplink Reinforcement panel, allowing Flotilla members to waste a Reinforcement. 
Fixed a script error when a join-in-progress player attempts to deploy their Oplink in the Murex Raid.

patchlogs.name: Operation: Scarlet Spear: Hotfix 27.3.2
patchlogs.changes:
Fixed cases of enemies not spawning after multiple mission runs with the Oplink.
Fixed Oplink state appearing as a filepath in the Flotilla squad labels above the Murex/Earth holograms.
Fixed a script error that resulted in an inability to deploy an Oplink if one was previously destroyed in the mission.

patchlogs.name: Operation: Scarlet Spear: Hotfix 27.3.1
patchlogs.changes: Squads Oplink state is now displayed with their respective label above either the Murex or Earth holograms. If you choose to deploy Oplink Reinforcement this information displays which squad could use your help the most!

patchlogs.name: Veilbreaker: Hotfix 32.0.2
patchlogs.changes:
When we were reviewing ammo acquisition as a whole for Update 32, we felt weapons with Ammo Regen Rate Overrides, or “Battery,” in particular, needed a place within the ecosystem of change we had established. That said, upon review of feedback, we recognize we were a bit heavy-handed with the changes we made to Battery weapons. We have restored their original values for the time being while we reassess how we can better approach these weapons.
We also missed a note from Update 32, where applying Pax Charge to Kitguns was also applying Ammo Regen Rate Overrides. But similar to the above, we have since reverted that for review.

patchlogs.name: Plains of Eidolon: Update 22.6.0 + Hotfix 22.6.0.1
patchlogs.changes:
The intent of the following changes is to make fishing a more harmonious experience for you and your squad! Until now, Bait, Dye, and Pharoma has only exclusively affected the player who used it. Moving forward, all squadmates will receive benefits from Bait or other fishing consumables in the Plains. The fish you see will still vary from player to player, however, the effects of these consumables will be shared across all members.
You can now throw Pharoma and Luminous Dye like Bait!*
Dye, Pharoma and Bait now only work within a certain radius around its casting point. Any player fishing within the radius around this casting point will benefit from its effects.
*In order for Luminous Dye and Pharoma to work within this system, they are now thrown like bait. They float in the water and affect all fish in the same body of water within a certain radius. This way you can cast out the Dye in one place, and all players will see the fish get highlighted as they swim near it. Multiple Dyes can be used at once, if you want to affect a larger section of the water.

patchlogs.fixes: Fixed a crash when Transferring to Operator while simultaneously activating a Remote Observer in Captura.

patchlogs.name: Fortuna: Update 24.0
patchlogs.fixes: Fixed inability to use a Remote Observer in the Orbiter with a Hotkey.

patchlogs.name: Chimera: Update 23.10
patchlogs.fixes: Fixed an issue where using Arching Launchers  in the Plains of Eidolon and a Remote Observer would permanently detach a player's camera.

patchlogs.name: Update 21: Chains of Harrow
patchlogs.fixes: Fixed Nidus’ Stack Counter being visible when using a Remote Observer.

patchlogs.name: Hotfix 17.0.3
patchlogs.changes: Entering / exiting the Remote Observer now has a unique audio effect.

patchlogs.name: Hotfix 17.0.2
patchlogs.changes:
The Remote Observer deploys a short-lived remote camera that overrides your Warframe optics.  This contraption allows Tenno to see from the Remote Observer’s position, making it easy to detect threats around corners...or view rooms from angles otherwise impossible.
The Remote Observer can be purchased from the Market for 10 credits, and is equipped in the Gear menu.
Added a maximum distance to where the Remote Observer can be placed.

description: Provokes an immediate confrontation with your Kuva Lich or Sister of Parvos: an insult which cannot be ignored.
name: Requiem Ultimatum

patchlogs.name: Update 31.5: Angels of the Zariman
patchlogs.fixes: Fixed Requiem Ultimatums not appearing in the End of Mission screen when rewarded.

patchlogs.name: Nora's Mix Volume 1: Update 31.2.0 + 31.2.0.1
patchlogs.fixes:
Fixed Requiem Ultimatums dropped from converted or vanquished Adversaries not being added to your inventory. As reported here: https://forums.warframe.com/topic/1294251-requiem-ultimatum-not-being-added-to-inventory/
Also fixed there being no indicators for the Requiem Ultimatum drops in the in-mission UI or the end of mission screen. 
We are looking into the possible options of rewarding those missing Requiem Ultimatums into inventories

patchlogs.name: Update 30.7: Nidus Prime & Plague Star
patchlogs.changes: Changed the sorting of items on the End Of Mission screen to better reflect importance, including Steel Essence, Riven Slivers, Granum Crowns, Built Forma, Orokin Cells, Corrupted Holokeys, built Prime parts, War Hilt, Requiem Ultimatums, Exilus Adapters, Drop Chance Boosters, Scintillant, and built Railjack Components.

patchlogs.name: Sisters of Parvos: Hotfix 30.5.5
patchlogs.fixes: Fixed case of Sister/Kuva Lich not spawning when using a Requiem Ultimatum, which also consumed the item.

patchlogs.name: Sisters of Parvos: Hotfix 30.5.2
patchlogs.fixes:
Fixed not actually receiving the Requiem Ultimatum after Converting/Vanquishing your Kuva Lich/Sister.
Accounts that did not actually receive their Requiem Ultimatum will be fixed upon login.

patchlogs.name: Update 30.5: Sisters of Parvos
patchlogs.changes:
Earn this Requiem Ultimatum as a 25% drop chance when choosing to either Convert or Vanquish your Kuva Lich or Sister of Parvos. *This Requiem only drops for the person whose Lich/Sister is downed.
Between reducing the required Murmurs, adding OULL, adding Requiem Ultimatums, and having this new flow, we have shortened the Kuva Lich cycle and added more control for all Tenno! The final fight is now on your terms, and we hope you enjoy the efforts to improve and simplify this system!
All Players who owned ANY Lich Weapon at any point OR have a Converted Lich OR have an active Lich get 1x Requiem Ultimatum (a new item to taunt a Lich or Sister into battle)!

patchlogs.name: Warframe Revised: Railjack Revisited (Part 1): Update 27.4
patchlogs.changes: Our Healing AoE / Damage Reduction changes posted back on April 3rd have arrived! If you’re unfamiliar, ultimately what we want is more ‘Healing’ Abilities to work to allow for more strategies to emerge in various mission types. Healing these objectives can serve well as an alternative or a complement to the commonly used defensive Abilities, such as Frost's Snow Globe, Gara's Mass Vitrify, Limbo's Cataclysm. 100% heals is not what we want to do, so we are instead allowing the effects with some objective-specific adjustments as to not trivialize the game modes.

patchlogs.name: Hotfix 25.6.3
patchlogs.fixes: Fixed having all Energy drained when casting Frost’s Freeze ability with the Freeze Frost Augment equipped on a Snow Globe.

patchlogs.name: Wukong Deluxe: Update 25.5.0 + 25.5.0.1
patchlogs.fixes: Fixed enemies being overly reluctant to shooting at Frost’s Snow Globe from a longer distance.

patchlogs.name: Buried Debts: Update 24.4.0
patchlogs.fixes: Fixed Frost’s Snow Globe no longer causing enemies to go flying if they are caught within cast.

patchlogs.name: Beasts of the Sanctuary: Hotfix 22.18.2
patchlogs.fixes: Fixed script error when casting Frost’s Snow Globe inside another invulnerable Snow Globe to stack them.

patchlogs.name: Beasts of the Sanctuary: Update 22.18.0
patchlogs.fixes: Fixed Frost’s Snow Globe disappearing if a large amount of damage is taken during its invulnerable phase.

patchlogs.name: Plains of Eidolon: Hotfix 22.8.3
patchlogs.changes: Tweaked the brightness/visibility of Frost’s Snow Globe in the Plains at night.

patchlogs.name: Plains of Eidolon: Hotfix 22.1.1
patchlogs.fixes: Fixed Frost’s Snow Globe having visible holes when observed from the inside.

patchlogs.name: Hydroid Prime: Hotfix 21.7.1
patchlogs.fixes: Fixed shooting Frost’s Snow Globe from the outside with the Lenz resulting in the Blast damage applying twice instead of Cold then Blast.

patchlogs.name: Chains of Harrow: Hotfix 21.0.7
patchlogs.changes: Fixed being unable to kill enemies inside a Nullifier bubble or Eximus Snow Globe with the Opticor. This also fixes being unable to hit Lephantis or Sargas Ruk at times.

patchlogs.name: Chains of Harrow: Hotfix 21.0.3
patchlogs.fixes: Fixed Opticor not being able to damage enemies outside of a Frost’s Snow Globe when fired from inside the Snow Globe.

patchlogs.name: Update 19.13.0
patchlogs.fixes: Fixed Frost’s Snow Globe ability radius stating the incorrect value in the Arsenal.

patchlogs.name: Banshee Prime: Hotfix 19.11.5 + 19.11.6
patchlogs.fixes: Fixed Arctic Eximus Snow Globe blocking explosion damage that they should not be blocking (and not blocking it when it should have). The barrier should now be closer to the visual representation.

patchlogs.name: The War Within: 19.0.7 - Valkyr Prime
patchlogs.fixes: Fixed enemies floating in mid-air when affected by both Frost’s Avalanche and Snow Globe.

patchlogs.name: Update 19: The War Within
patchlogs.changes: Corpus Nullifiers and white-suited Corpus Targets (capable of creating a Snow Globe-esqe barrier) no longer appear on lower level Capture missions.

patchlogs.name: The Index Preview: Hotfix #3
patchlogs.fixes: Fixed cases where NPCs would teleport sporadically when pushed by Frost's Snow Globe.

patchlogs.name: The Silver Grove
patchlogs.changes: Frost’s Freeze, Ice Wave and Snow Globe now also reduce target’s Mobility in Conclave

patchlogs.name: Specters of the Rail: Hotfix 13
patchlogs.changes: Arctic Eximus Snow Globe blocks radial damage, but will no longer block damage from sources inside the globe. This allows most non targeted powers that damage enemies to work versus Arctic Eximus within a snow globe.

patchlogs.name: Update 18.5: Sands of Inaros
patchlogs.fixes: Frost’s Snow Globe will no longer freeze or push boss-type enemies.

patchlogs.name: Update 18: The Second Dream
patchlogs.changes: Iron Skin has received the following changes:Iron Skin has damage absorb period at beginning and is affected by armour, like Snow Globe and Tectonics.

patchlogs.name: Update 17.7
patchlogs.fixes: Fixed Atlas’ Tectonics being unable to go through Frost’s Snow Globe as per: https://forums.warframe.com/index.php?/topic/541593-tectonics-boulder-can-not-go-through-snow-globe/

patchlogs.name: Hotfix 17.6.1
patchlogs.changes: Corpus Nullifiers will no longer destroy Frost’s Snow Globes if Frost enters the Nullifier Shield and globes are placed elsewhere.

patchlogs.name: Hotfix 17.0.5
patchlogs.changes: Frost’s Snow Globes can now be broken when Freeze is cast on it, causing the Snow Globe to explode and do an AoE ragdoll effect on nearby enemies.

patchlogs.name: Hotfix 17.0.3
patchlogs.changes: Reduced the health of Frost’s Snow Globe in PvP.
patchlogs.fixes:
Fixed Frost’s Snow Globe not disappearing on death.
Fixed Frost’s Snow Globe not using the proper timer for Clients.

patchlogs.name: Hotfix 17.0.2
patchlogs.fixes: Fixed Frost’s Snow Globe not properly being affected by power range Mods.

patchlogs.name: Update 17: Echoes Of The Sentient
patchlogs.changes:
Snow Globe will Freeze and push out all enemies that are within radius upon cast.
Snow Globe no longer has a Duration Timer.
Players can now have a maximum of 4 Snow Globes.
Recasting Snow Globe at 4 will destroy the oldest globe.

patchlogs.name: Update 16.2
patchlogs.fixes: Increased Frost’s Snow Globe slowdown effect in PvP.

patchlogs.name: Hotfix 16.1.3
patchlogs.fixes: Fixed some instances of black textures appearing on Frost’s Snow Globe.

patchlogs.name: Hotfix 15.13.3
patchlogs.changes: Players should now be able to clearly see the short pulse of Frost’s Snow Globe that indicates its invulnerability period.

patchlogs.name: Update 15.13
patchlogs.changes: Casting Frost’s Snow Globe inside of a Snow Globe you previously created will combine the health of both globes, eliminating the old Globe in the process. This will allow for greater combat visibility as your view won’t be obscured by opaque stacked Snow-Globe walls!

patchlogs.name: Hotfix 15.0.7
patchlogs.fixes: • Fixed an issue with Coolant Leak removing Snow Globe slow on enemies.

patchlogs.name: Warframe: Archwing
patchlogs.fixes: Fixed Frost’s Snow Globe inner snowstorm effects not scaling properly with Range mods, resulting in it not matching the outer globe scale.

patchlogs.name: Hotfix 14.1.4
patchlogs.changes: Reduced the Snow Globe health and duration in Dark Sector conflicts.

patchlogs.name: Update 13.3.0: Pack Hunters
patchlogs.changes: Set a max limit on the max instances of Frost's Snow Globe sound effects.

patchlogs.name: Hotfix 8.3.1
patchlogs.fixes: Fix for Snow Globe “Power in Use” bug.

patchlogs.name: Hotfix 8.1.2
patchlogs.fixes: Fixed incorrect tooltip description for Snow Globe

patchlogs.name: Update 7.9.0: The Glaive
patchlogs.fixes: Fixed Frost's Snow Globe power not being affected by Continuity and Range mods.

patchlogs.name: Update 6.5 Hotfixes
patchlogs.fixes: Fixed an issue with Snow Globe persisting if user dies and then revives while it is active.

patchlogs.fixes: Fixed being in an unarmed state when attempting to switch to a Synthesis Scanner while sheathing a weapon.

patchlogs.name: The Glast Gambit: Hotfix 19.11.2
patchlogs.fixes: Fixed the Synthesis Scanner counting as ‘next shot’ or ‘next hit’ for the purpose of some Warframe Abilities/Passives (Volt’s Static Passive, Mesa’s Ballistic Battery, etc).

patchlogs.name: The War Within: Hotfix 19.3.2 + 19.3.2.1
patchlogs.changes: The number of items received from purchasing or crafting items that give more than one of it is now indicated in the UI (i.e Specter Blueprints from Syndicates, Synthesis Scanners from Simaris, etc).

patchlogs.name: Specters of the Rail: Hotfix 13
patchlogs.changes: Changed how Simaris’ Synthesis Target Standing is decided in a group: you now get Standing if you have a Synthesis Scanner equipped, are actively playing, and it's your daily target or you are within shared XP range of the target.

patchlogs.name: Update 18.5: Sands of Inaros
patchlogs.fixes:
Fixed Clients being unable to switch out of a Synthesis Scanner when they only have a secondary weapon equipped in a Mission.
Fixed Codex and Synthesis Scanner audio FX playing for entire squad, instead of just for the player using the Scanner.

patchlogs.name: Update 17.2
patchlogs.fixes: Fixed the UI becoming permanently tinted the wrong color if using a hotkey to switch off the Synthesis Scanner.

patchlogs.name: Update 16.1: Volt Prime
patchlogs.fixes: Fixed players without a Synthesis Scanner equipped receiving mid-Mission notification of a rare capture target.

patchlogs.name: Hotfix 16.0.4
patchlogs.fixes: Players without a Synthesis Scanner equipped during a scan will no longer receive Synthesis progress.

patchlogs.name: Warframe: Sanctuary
patchlogs.fixes:
In the cradle of space on Tenno Relays across the Solar System Cephalon Simaris has constructed a Sanctuary with the goal of eternally preserving all life.  But Simaris needs your help, Tenno.  Using Simaris’ advanced Synthesis Scanner you must track down unique targets to scan in a Codex shared by Tenno all over the world, and help unlock exciting new lore and Syndicate rewards.
Synthesis Scanners can be equipped like regular Gear, and are used in the same fashion a Codex scanner is.

patchlogs.name: Update 30.7: Nidus Prime & Plague Star
patchlogs.changes: Zephyr’s Airburst was intended to pull enemies in like Vortex for a short duration, but was spawning exactly where the projectile hit, resulting in being inside the floor. We fixed it by making the vortex spawn a bit above the floor and in the process gave it an FX pass to communicate better what was happening.

patchlogs.fixes: Fixed Vauban’s Vortex affecting play Mechs movement.

Vortex is now attached to the front of your Railjack
Increased Vortex radius from 30 to 60

patchlogs.name: The Old Blood: Hotfix 26.0.7
patchlogs.changes: Decreased the forward movement of the first attack in the Tactical Forward Combo (Blazing Vortex) and increased it in the second.

patchlogs.name: Update 26: The Old Blood
patchlogs.changes: When a Bastille’s duration expires, it collapses into a brief Vortex at the center of the cast for easy group kills. Want the Vortex to appear sooner, or last longer? Holding the cast key will collapse all active Bastilles early, or if you have no Bastilles, holding will deploy a new Vortex instead.

patchlogs.name: Fortuna: Hotfix 24.0.9
patchlogs.fixes: Fixed multiple Warframe abilities (Nidus’ Larva, Vauban’s Vortex, etc) breaking due to a script error occurring when an AI recovered from a ragdolled state as reported here: https://forums.warframe.com/topic/1032142-nidus-larva-bugging-out-fix-pending/?page=11&tab=comments#comment-10334248

patchlogs.name: Update 21: Chains of Harrow
patchlogs.fixes: Fixed Vauban’s Vortex sometimes spontaneously killing enemies.

patchlogs.name: Octavia’s Anthem: Hotfix 20.2.3
patchlogs.fixes: Fixed Vauban's Vortex not affecting ragdolled enemies.

patchlogs.name: Octavia's Anthem: Update 20
patchlogs.changes: Fixed an issue with the flashing reticule hitmaker during Vauban’s Vortex, and Nezha’s Blazing Chakram and Warding Halo.

patchlogs.name: The Pacifism Defect: Hotfix 19.12.2
patchlogs.fixes: Fixed Vauban’s Bastille and Vortex lingering in tiles after players have left said tile.This resulted in enemies continually being damaged or immobile even after the ability ended.

patchlogs.name: Banshee Prime: Hotfix 19.11.5 + 19.11.6
patchlogs.fixes: Fixed an issue where Simulor Vortexes will turn invisible when fully stacked and last forever when playing on a Dedicated Server as per: https://forums.warframe.com/topic/752128-simulor-synoid-bugged/#comment-8322988

patchlogs.name: The War Within: Hotfix 19.3.1
patchlogs.fixes: Fixed memory/object leak with Vauban's Vortex and Simulor.

patchlogs.name: The Index Preview: Hotfix #2
patchlogs.changes: Excluded Reactant and Index Point pickups from Simulor, Inaros' Sandstorm, Zephyr Tornado, and Vauban's Vortex. This also fixes the exception lists for the Simulor; it wasn't supposed to be moving  gameplay objects (eg Datamass, Excavation Power Cells, Raptor Cells, etc) but it generally wasn't of a problem because the objects were heavy enough (properly excluding them should run faster too!). As more and more gameplay components rely on pickups, we've addressed this issue as it is commonly discussed by you all.

patchlogs.name: The Index Preview
patchlogs.fixes: Fixed Vauban Bastille and Vortex balls being auto-destroyed a second after they collided with something.

patchlogs.name: Hotfix 18.13.2
patchlogs.fixes: Fixed Mag’s Magnetize bubble lingering permanently when Vauban’s Vortex/Bastille is thrown inside it. This also fixes intensified FX in this situation that caused performance issues.

patchlogs.name: Update 18.12.0: Vauban Prime & 18.12.1
patchlogs.fixes: •    Fixed Power Strength Mods (Blind Rage, Intensify, etc.) not applying very much to Vauban’s Vortex initial blast and damage over time.

patchlogs.name: Update 18.5: Sands of Inaros
patchlogs.fixes: Increased the duration of Vauban’s Vortex in Conclave.

patchlogs.name: Hotfix 17.10.1
patchlogs.fixes: Fixed Ember's Fireblast, Vauban's Vortex and Volt's Electric Shield Abilities being cancelled when you enter a Nullifier Bubble.

patchlogs.name: Hotfix 16.3.4
patchlogs.fixes: Fixed Vauban’s Perpetual Vortex Mod no longer pulling in enemies after the initial Vortex time has ended.

patchlogs.name: Hotfix 16.3.3 + 16.3.3.1
patchlogs.changes: Perpetual Vortex: Vortex's duration is increased by % for each additional Vortex thrown into the initial Vortex.

patchlogs.fixes: Fixed performance issues that would occur in long sessions where Vauban's Vortex was often used, resulting in FPS issues.

patchlogs.name: Update 14.9.0
patchlogs.fixes: Fixes reported cases of clients not being able to damage enemies caught in Vortex when using the Ogris, Torid, etc.

patchlogs.name: Hotfix 14.7.4
patchlogs.fixes: Fixed Vauban's Bounce and Vortex appearing with default energy colour for clients.

patchlogs.name: Update 14.7.0: Operation Gate Crash!
patchlogs.fixes: Fixed an issue where enemies caught in Vauban’s Vortex will oscillate and vibrate in an unappealing way.

patchlogs.name: Update 14.5: Operation Cryotic Front!
patchlogs.changes: • Made Vauban's Vortex scale with power range and duration mods.

patchlogs.name: Hotfix 14.0.11
patchlogs.fixes: Reduced the duration of Vauban's Vortex in Dark Sector conflicts.

patchlogs.name: Hotfix 12.4.3
patchlogs.changes: Fixed enemies not being affected by Vortex or Tornado if one was placed in the vicinity of a 'friendly' target (cryopod, sentinel, etc).

patchlogs.name: Hotfix 12.4.2
patchlogs.fixes: Fixed Zephyr’s Tornado and Vauban’s Vortex being able to ragdoll harder enemies (Mini-bosses like Stalker, etc). The Tornado will still deal DOT, but it won’t ragdoll. It is now consistent with other ragdoll-esque powers.

patchlogs.name: Update 12.2.0: Castanas!
patchlogs.fixes: Fixed issue where enemies would stand up in the middle of a blackhole or blackhole like situation (Vortex, etc.).

patchlogs.name: Hotfix 12.0.2
patchlogs.fixes: Fixed Vauban’s Vortex not ragdolling enemies.

patchlogs.name: Hotfix 11.9.2
patchlogs.fixes: Fixed performance issues when using Vauban's Vortex in situations with high enemy counts.

patchlogs.name: Hotfix 11.1.2
patchlogs.fixes: Fixed issues with Vauban’s Vortex causing crashes when dealing damage.

patchlogs.fixes: Fixed Infested chargers and ancients not being appropriately affected by Vauban’s Vortex ability.

Energy color tinting for Vauban’s Tesla and Vortex abilities.

Fixed ragdolls being destroyed when held in a Vortex for too long (more than 15 seconds).
